creator: Kajnjaps
title: The Godot Machine
materials_required: Discrete transistors (Q2, Q3, Q4, Q1, Q6, Q7, Q8)
LED-bar with 4 LEDs or 4 separate red LEDs
description: The Godot Machine is a solar-powered electronic art piece that embodies the feeling of waiting, possibly pointlessly, for something to happen. It uses a Joule Thief circuit to charge capacitors, which then power an Arduino Nano. The Arduino generates random numbers and compares them to a stored number. If a match occurs, a green LED and beeper activate, signifying the end of the wait. The matching probability is low, making the wait potentially very long.
steps: Build a Joule Thief energy harvester to charge 9x2200uF capacitors using transistor Q1.
Construct a discrete transistor power switch using transistors Q2, Q3, and Q4, designed to switch on at 5.1V and off at 3.0V.
Create an entropy generator using transistors Q6, Q7, and Q8 to amplify electronic noise. Use a piece of guitar string as an antenna for the entropy generator.
Connect a 4-LED bar, a piezo beeper, and a green LED to the Arduino Nano.
Connect the output of the power switch (collector of Q4) to the 5V pin of the Arduino Nano, NOT to the VIN pin.
Assemble the circuit on a perfboard.
Mount the solar panel and circuit board onto pieces of plywood, allowing the solar panel to be positioned towards the sun.
Upload the provided Arduino code to the Arduino Nano.  The code generates random numbers based on a logistic map seeded with the electronic noise from the entropy generator.
The Arduino code measures the voltage from the entropy generator on pin A0, keeps the 4 least significant bits, and shifts them into a seed value.
Rescale the seed between 0 and 1 and calculate the average of the seed and x, the current state of the logistic map.
Advance the logistic map many (64) steps and extract a single bit from the logistic map state x by checking some insignificant decimal.
Shift that bit into the final result, and repeat the above steps 20 times.
Observe the Godot Machine and wait for the generated random number to match the number stored in the EEPROM. If it matches, the green LED and piezo beeper will activate.
